qas.question: What is the second largest port in the UK?
Approximately how much was spent on non-food retail sales in London in 2010?
How much cargo does the Port of London handle annually?
What is London's second most competitive industry?
What corporation is the major player in London's media distribution industry?

context: Along with professional services, media companies are concentrated in London and the <a3_0>media distribution<a3_0/> industry is London's second most competitive sector. <a4_0>The BBC<a4_0/> is a significant employer, while other broadcasters also have headquarters around the City. Many national newspapers are edited in London. London is a major retail centre and in 2010 had the highest non-food retail sales of any city in the world, with a total spend of around <a1_0>£64.2 billion<a1_0/>. <a0_0>The Port of London<a0_0/> is the second-largest in the United Kingdom, handling <a2_0>45 million tonnes<a2_0/> of cargo each year.
